## RLog.withEnricher() method

Creates a new [RLog](./rlog.rlog.md) instance with the given `enricher` added.

Enrichers are callbacks that may or may not add data to (or mutate directly) a [LogEntry](./rlog.logentry.md)<!-- -->.

In the case of multiple enrichers, they are called in the order they are added.

Furthermore, child enrichers are called before [parent](./rlog.rlog.child.md) enrichers.

\_Note that enrichers are called before sinks.\_

**Signature:**

```typescript
withEnricher(enricher: LogEnricherCallback, minLevel?: LogLevel): RLog;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

enricher


</td><td>

[LogEnricherCallback](./rlog.logenrichercallback.md)


</td><td>

The enricher callback.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

minLevel


</td><td>

[LogLevel](./rlog.loglevel.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The minimum [LogLevel](./rlog.loglevel.md) for the enricher. The enricher will not be called for logs that are below this. Defaults to [LogLevel.VERBOSE](./rlog.loglevel.md)<!-- -->.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[RLog](./rlog.rlog.md)

The new [RLog](./rlog.rlog.md) instance.

## Example


```ts
function MyCustomEnricher(entry: LogEntry, config: RLogConfig): LogEntry {
  // attach the local player's user id if we're running in a LocalScript
  if(RunService.IsClient()) {
    entry.data["player"] = Players.LocalPlayer.UserId;
  }

  // return the modified entry
  return entry;
}

const logger = new RLog().withEnricher(MyCustomEnricher);

logger.v("Hello verbose");
// > [VERBOSE]: Hello Verbose
// > { "data": { "player": 1333 } }
```
